item.title: Rinne Silences Blackhawks
item.description: The Blackhawks emphatic use of "Chelsea Dagger" may be the most iconic goal song in the NHL. But through two games of their opening round playoff series the catchy song from the Scottish rock band The Fratellis has been silenced by rangy Finnish goaltender Pekka Rinne of the Predators.

item.title: Wanted Florida Teacher May Be In Nashville
item.description: A teacher wanted on multiple charges in Florida, including the production of child pornography, may be in Nashville.

item.title: Oktoberfest Forces Couple To Move Wedding Date
item.description: A couple booked their wedding at Nashville's Bicentennial Mall, but after almost a year of planning they were forced to move the date because of Nashville's Oktoberfest.

item.title: Two Victims Use Kindness To Survive Attacks
item.description: The victim of a brutal rape, robbery, and kidnapping in the Belmont area detailed how she befriended her attacker to survive. She shared her story in front of a judge, attorneys, and the man accused of those crimes at a preliminary hearing.
